channel.title: Assignments on MIT OpenCourseWare
channel.description: Recent content in Assignments on MIT OpenCourseWare

item.title: Assignments
item.description:
This section contains the labs that were done during class, along with example solutions, and a small section of miscellaneous items.

Labs and Solutions

DESCRIPTION FILES SOLUTIONS
Lab 3 covered control flow with if-elif-else statements. (PDF) Â 
Lab 4 covered control flow with while statements. (PDF)

login.py (PY)

nims1.py (PY)

nims2.py (PY)
Lab 5 covered the use of lists in storing a dynamic number of values. (PDF)

sorting.py (PY)

item.title: collision.py
item.description: Python computer program provided as a solution to Lab 6.

item.title: genetic.py
item.description: Python computer program provided as a solution to Lab 8.

item.title: htmltext.py
item.description: Python computer program provided as a supporting file to Lab 9.

item.title: inventory_soln.py
item.description: Python computer program provided as a solution to Lab 10.

item.title: inventory.py
item.description: Python computer program provided as a supporting file to Lab 10.

item.title: lab10.pdf
item.description: Instructions for Lab 10: Compound Dictionaries. Lab 10 covered a more advanced use of dictionaries. The bulk of the lab was to improve the web indexer we built in the previous lab.

item.title: lab3.pdf
item.description: Instructions for Lab 3: Control Flow with If-Else-Elif. Lab 3 covered control flow with if-elif-else statements.

item.title: lab4.pdf
item.description: Instructions for Lab 4: Control Flow with While. Lab 4 covered control flow with while statements.

item.title: lab5.pdf
item.description: Instructions for Lab 5: Working with Lists. Lab 5 covered the use of lists in storing a dynamic number of values.

item.title: lab6.pdf
item.description: Instructions for Lab 6: Tuples and Strings. Lab 6 covered the use of tuples instead of lists and their similarity with strings.

item.title: lab7.pdf
item.description: Instructions for Lab 7: Introduction to Objects. Lab 7 was a walk through tutorial that introduced the idea of objects as opposed to primitive types like ints and floats.

item.title: lab8.pdf
item.description: Instructions for Lab 8: Working with Objects. Lab 8 covered the use of member functions in various objects.

item.title: lab9.pdf
item.description: Instructions for Lab 9: Introduction to Dictionaries. Lab 9 covered the use and syntax of dictionaries. The bulk of the lab was to explore one common use of dictionaries as indexes, in this case, for searching the Web.

item.title: localsites.zip
item.description: Archive of web content for use with Lab 9.

item.title: operator.pdf
item.description: Cheat sheet on some of the various arithmetic and boolean (comparison, equality, and logic) operators covered in the course.

item.title: optional.pdf
item.description: Optional assignment on how a computer works.
